result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M Benish

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for the 10/7/16 Plea/Sentencing Hearing filed by Court Reporter Catherine Thimm-Braunschweig

Cases called at 1:13 p.m.: 15CF418, 16CF59, 16CM153, 16CF274. 15TR4619,  Defendant Thomas M Benish in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1 in 16CF59 & 15CF418. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence to prison for 3 years in each case consisting of 1 year confinement, 2 yrs. Extended Supervision,  Conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. $518 costs in 15CF418, $268 costs in 16CF59. In 16CF59, count 2 dismissed.  In 15CF418, ct. 2 read in and dismissed. 15CF418 consecutive to 16CF59. 16CM153 & 16CF274 read in and dismissed. 15TR4619, not guilty entered, to be set for trial.  Court read in and dismissed 16CM153 & 16CF274. Defendant is eligible for Earned Early Release and Challenge Academy. Jail credit to be determined.  Court adjourned at 1:31 p.m.

Defendant Thomas M Benish in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, matters to be set for Arraignment/Plea/Sentencing w/JA
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek, requesting a reset of 8-4-16 return date, due to a scheduling conflict.

Cases called: 16CM153, 15CF418 & 16CF59, Defendant Thomas M Benish in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset requested.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Motion for Preservation of Evidence filed by attorney Amanda Riek
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by  ADA Crystal Long
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by  ADA Crystal Long
Copy of Letter from ADA Crystal Long to Atty Amanda Riek  re:  Discovery.
not possess controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia

Defendant Thomas M Benish in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading, $150.00 sign bond, not possess controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia, 15 CF 418 and 16 CF 59 to track w/cases  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
